title: What's Your Summer Jam?
description: Let us know what songs you loved in summers past, and we'll let you know which song you'll love this summer.
teaser: Now turn up your new music and see if you can beat Slate's Bribery Quiz.

a.descriptor: You like hip-pop jams that make you wanna get drunk on the minibar. Here’s the current No. 1 song on the Hot 100 from the fast-rising female, white, Australian rapper getting a major assist from the hook-purveyor from last year’s Icona Pop jam “I Love It.” Buy this song »
a.share_text: My summer jam is "Fancy" by Iggy Azalea!

b.descriptor: You like thumping pop-&-B that makes you wanna drop it low. For you, the latest minimalist trap-pop jam from a remarkably resilient hitmaker (since 2009) who’s coming off the winter hit “Talk Dirty” and this time is backed by prior summer-song-supporter Snoop. Buy this song »
b.share_text: My summer jam is "Wiggle" by Jason Derulo!

c.descriptor: You like big-voiced diva-pop with just a splash of hip-hop attitude. On this horn-inflected urban-pop jam, the rising starlet behind 2013’s “The Way” is backed by the omnipresent rapper; it’s currently a Hot 100 No. 2, held off by Iggy’s other hit, “Fancy.” Buy this song »
c.share_text: My summer jam is "Problem" by Ariana Grande!

d.descriptor: You like your dance music widescreen and wistful. This hit by the formerly invisible Scottish DJ/producer is the latest to feature his vocals—he manned the boards behind Rihanna on “We Found Love” and Florence Welch on “Sweet Nothing” but sung his own “Feel So Close” in 2012. Buy this song »
d.share_text: My summer jam is "Summer" by Calvin Harris!

e.content: Miranda Lambert feat. Carrie Underwood, “Somethin’ Bad”
e.descriptor: You like rockers that make you want to bang your head and stomp your feet. Country’s answer to “No More Tears” or “Telephone”—a summit by a pair of reigning queens teaming for the first time—this rocking song is closer to Mutt Lange than Ole Opry. Buy this song »
e.share_text: My summer jam is "Somethin' Bad" by Miranda Lambert!

f.content: Michael Jackson, “Love Never Felt So Good”
f.descriptor: You like your summer jams old-school but new-sounding. This reanimated 1983 song, penned by Paul Anka and sung by Jackson during the Thriller era, was lovingly rebuilt by producer Timbaland for the Xscape project; one version features vocals by Justin Timberlake. Buy this song »
f.share_text: My summer jam is "Love Never Felt So Good" by Michael Jackson!

g.descriptor: You want your summer to rock out—but in a quirky way. This odd, three-year-old, lurching accordion-inflected rock song by a South African band just crossed to U.S. radio this year—it topped Billboard’s Alternative chart in the spring and is now getting picked up by top 40 radio. Buy this song »
g.share_text: My summer jam is "Come with Me Now" by Kongos!

h.descriptor: You like summer torch songs with just a bit of bite. This is the new single from the rapper/Idol judge/pop-culture phenom with a strong summer-hit track record; its tempo, framed by a mantra-like “I still love” refrain, is ballad-like, offset by more aggressive rap verses. Buy this song »
h.share_text: My summer jam is "Pill n Potions" by Nicki Minaj!

i.descriptor: You like your summer pop airy and ethereal but very catchy. This leftfield hit is already in Billboard’s Top 10—a shimmering midtempo pop tune with African flavors, performed by a Norwegian duo formerly known as Envy, that has the unorthodox infectiousness of Gotye. Buy this song »
i.share_text: My summer jam is "Am I Wrong" by Nico & Vinz!

j.descriptor: You like your summer music really laid-back and slack. For all you Ras Trents out there, here’s a white-boy-reggae smash by a Canadian band, about a guy trying to get past his intended’s intransigent dad; as if that lyrical trope weren’t enough like “Two Princes,” lead singer/producer Nasri wears a knit cap. Buy this song »
j.share_text: My summer jam is "Rude" by MAGIC!

k.descriptor: You like summer music frothy and even a bit goofy. Here’s the latest from the irrepressible hitmaker who’s brought us several hot-weather dominators but hasn’t had an undeniable summer hit since 2011’s “Last Friday Night”; given its title, Perry appears to want that sweet, sweet publishing-perennial dollar. Buy this song »
k.share_text: My summer jam is "Birthday" by Katy Perry!

l.descriptor: You want a summer jam for both body and mind. This thumping, buzzing electro-club song is the title track from an imminent album by the Swedish goddess of indie-pop teaming with the Norwegian ambient duo who’ve been together since EDM was “electronica.” Buy this song »
l.share_text: My summer jam is "Do It Again" by Robyn & Röyksopp!

m.descriptor: You like your summer jams a bit boy-bandy but also a little funky. This Pharrell-produced hit—not Timberlake, but a remarkable facsimile—is an acoustic guitar–plus–dance beats–plus-falsetto jam from the U.K. singer-songwriter leaping from his prior delicate ballads to the top 40 brass ring. Buy this song »
m.share_text: My summer jam is "Sing" by Ed Sheeran!

n.descriptor: You have a taste for soulful, emotional summer tunes. This potent piano ballad and breakthrough solo hit from an operatic-voiced Brit (“the male Adele”) was introduced to U.S. audiences via SNL and his guest vocals on two prior dance-pop hits—one, “Latch,” is also rising at pop radio.
n.share_text: My summer jam is "Stay With Me" by Sam Smith!

o.content: DJ Snake & Lil Jon, “Turn Down for What”
o.descriptor: Whether hip-hop or electro, you like summer hits to keep you moving—hard. On this trap-dance smash and unlikely comeback hit from the mid-’00s crunk godfather/Dave Chappelle parody subject, Lil Jon cannily teams with a French electro DJ to score his first Top 10 hit in five years. Buy this song »
o.share_text: My summer jam is "Turn Down For What" by DJ Snake & Lil Jon!

p.descriptor: In any season, you have a taste for the eccentric. This catchy, über-indie first single from the new album by Merrill Garbus—a celebrated worldbeat-by-way-of-Connecticut artist who topped 2011’s Pazz & Jop critics’ poll—is unlikely to appear on top 40 radio anytime soon but might just soundtrack your summer. Buy this song »
p.share_text: My summer jam is "Water Fountain" by tUnE-yArDs!

q.descriptor: You like R&B that works in the bedroom as well as on the dance floor. This sweaty, syncopated, boudoir-ready, and acclaimed single by the now-veteran (20 years!) R&B crooner with the killer falsetto has been slow to catch on at pop radio, but it’s now rising into the R&B radio Top 10—they know what’s up. Buy this song »
q.share_text: My summer jam is "Good Kisser" by Usher!

questions.content: Which Summer 2013 jam do you like best?

choices.content: Daft Punk feat. Pharrell Williams, “Get Lucky”
Icona Pop feat. Charli XCX, “I Love It”
Robin Thicke feat. T.I. and Pharrell, “Blurred Lines”
I don't know or like any of these songs.
